Reviews.Title: “Bijou rooms but good central hotel at good price”
Reviews.Author: G07
Reviews.Content: Very clean. Helpful staff. Good value. Good central position close to Raffles and Clarke Quay. Good breakfast. A bit noisy in the morning after 8.00 am as there is some major building work going on at the back of the hotel. Rooms are small but ok. If you are a couple make sure you know each other well as there is little space for privacy. Check out the roof terrace for stunning views but this is a bit rough and ready. Overall for the price very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there!”
Reviews.Author: Craio
Reviews.Content: All the hotel rooms are very small. We received a room which overlooked a construction site and the noise inside the room was unbearable even with the windows shut. We went back to the reception to ask for another room facing the front of the hotel and we were greeted with a very unfriendly reaction - the staff at the reception was really surprised we asked for a different room and explained the noise will stop in 4-5 hours and that the next day was Sunday, so the works will have the day off. We did insist on getting another room and we managed to receive a key for a room on the floor above but which had a really bad smell, the window was locked so no chance for fresh air either. We therefore decided to keep our initial room as they were even more reluctant when we went down the second time to complain about our room and motivated those were the only rooms available for the period of our stay. The bathroom is literally part of the room, separated only by a glass door with no privacy whatsoever and the bathroom sink is outside the bathroom in one corner of the room. The breakfast is quite poor and not well supplied during the hours they serve breakfast. If you wake up early and get to the restaurant around 8, you might get all the variety, but an hour later - just leftovers not being refilled. Will certainly not recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: MichelleandMichel
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights, and found the hotel to be satisfactory. The location is fantastic as you can just walk a few blocks to the MRT, Clarke Quay and the River walk. The rooms are small and well decorated, the beds are comfortable, the TV and air conditioning worked well, and the breakfast was good. The only problem we encountered was the musty smell in the room, which took a while to get used to.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & Staff”
Reviews.Author: ICostin9087
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for 1 night on our way back home and we were very pleased with our choice. It's next to Clarke Quay, and 1 metro station from Chinatown, a perfect place for a 1 day city trip. The staff was very helpfull and we appreciated the free shower & towels (10 hours after check-out). Breakfast was good also. Standard windowless rooms are very small but very well equiped, i would not recommend this type of room for more than 1/2 nights. The price was also good (according to Singapore's standards :) ) . Thank you Jayleen !

Reviews.Title: “Balanced quality and budget”
Reviews.Author: outhome
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2012 Apr for 1week, room is not fancy perhaps "as required" basis but convenient location and budget still deserve to stay. Clark Quay and BoatQuay both are in few minutes walk, visiting China Town is also in good walking distance like 10-15min, even city center around Raffles can be in walking territory. This location is really convenient for shopping in daytime, enjoying various Chinese food, perhaps trying sea food at BoatQuay, relaxing in river wind with drinks and easy to find bars nearby in late night. One comment for hotel is about breakfast, hotel opens breakfast at 7:30, it is relatively late for business purpose sometimes and there is quite few other choices around hotel at that morning time.(nearest Starbucks in ClarkQuay opens at 8:00 or 8:30) It would be more helpful if it can start bit earlier even with limited choice of food.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel”
Reviews.Author: curi0ust00
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel goes above and beyond to be helpful, hospitable and nice. Add to this a generous and tasty breakfast and you can see why we are enthusiastic.Best hotel experience we ever had and we are seasoned travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Small,Comfortable,Homely and Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Revathi K
Reviews.Content: We went to visit Singapore in April 2011 and decided to stay at The BEST WESTERN Jayleen 1918, mainly because it was next to practically everything and most importantly, the tube station was a 5-minute walk from the hotel. Since Singapore was an extremely expensive place we were quite surprised at the wallet-friendly rates and we didn't expect the rooms to be spotlessly clean and the beds to be comfy and soft. The staff were very helpful and friendly and the owner was so nice. Since we had to leave the hotel at 5 in the morning to catch our flight we asked the owner to see if she could scrape together a meal for us with the left-overs of the night before before we left, but instead when we got up that morning and went downstairs we were pleasantly shocked to find a huge, but not too heavy breakfast laid out for us!! So if you don't want to burn a hole in your wallet and are more of a sight-seeing person I recommend the BEST WESTERN Jayleen 1918 to you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Eloise H
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Jayleen 1918. The location is excellent - between Boat Quay and Clark Quay, close to shopping, food, museums. Clean rooms and friendly staff. We had four suitcases in a double room and found room for everything. Would happily return.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest of Rooms”
Reviews.Author: MORREY
Reviews.Content: We where amazed at how small the double room was in this hotel. Its the smallest we have ever had. You can just get your cases (2) in the room, then it must remain against the door or in front of the sink which blocks the door to to toilet or your exit. The second person in the bed has to climb over the other to get out. The breakfast was far from the standard of other Best Western Hotels that we have stayed in other countries. The staff at reception however were pleasant and accommodating. The location was good as it is near to Chinatown/Clarkes Quay and the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel near a mall and boat quay”
Reviews.Author: Racq
Reviews.Content: Best Western Jayleen is located beside a souvenir shop, 5 minutes walk to Central Mall and Clarke Quay where you can take a boat for sightseeing. Near to it is a Bungy jump area and a bus stop where you can join the City Sightseeing hop on hop off bus for only SGD23. The hotel has a nice bathroom but with a small double bed and a small blanket for a couple. My husband and I are the normal size Asians but if you're a Caucasian with a big body and long legs, you may feel uncomfortable. We had backaches due to the bed. Buffet breakfast is the usual cereal with milk, bread, jam, butter, chicken curry, rice, hotdogs and like banana, papaya or watermelon. One night at about 10 PM, the fire alarm sounded. Since we are in the third floor, my husband took the stairs to find out from reception if there's a fire, they said they are checking on it. As we were about to sleep, we have to call them and find out if there's really a fire. They never even bothered to explain. I would like to commend one of their front office receptionist, her name is Ida, a Filipino. She was very accommodating and even bothered to check the internet and print the location of the catholic church where we have to attend a Sunday mass. Other than this, she extended her kindness by teaching us the way where we want to go. Restaurant Tip: If you want to try the authentic local Singaporean dish, try Bak Ku Tek. It's about 5 minutes walk from the hotel and almost right in front of the Pedestrian Lane. They serve good food at SGD6-8 per viand, a cup of rice cost SGD0.60. There's also a food court at the basement of Central Mall. The cheapest I've seen is worth SGD4.50 for crispy chicken with a cup of rice. Try the store beside the bakeshop that sells Portuguese Tarts. The tarts didn't taste good though.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: RonSyson
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this hotel around the same time as some of the reviewers early November 2011 I agree that the location is excellent the staff were very helpful and friendly rooms were clean and in good condition. Yes rooms are small and there is noise from the night clubs. The breakfast was OK but fresh omletes were available on request. Whilst we were staying there there was a massive electrical storm and the next day the air con was triping the electrical system the staff were constantly restoring power and doing everthing they could to keep things going. It is not the best Best Western I have stayed in but certainly far from the worst beware Amman.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money - by Singapore standards - and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Seasondtraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel's strongest advantage is its ideal location, close to many things, including Chinatown, Boat Quay, the Asian Civilisations Museum and a metro. My room was clean and comfortable. Breakfast was alright. Service was friendly. There is a bar nextdoor but it was not that loud. The price was very attractive compared with the general level of hotel prices in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “No sleep and bad service!”
Reviews.Author: Aboud J
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend at this hotel in November 2011. The only positive aspect is the location of the hotel close to Clarke Quay, Boat Quay and the shopping area. For the negative aspects I have a whole list. 1/ We first chose a room with no window for the lower price, but after seeing what it looked like (it was very very small, we couldn't even open our suitcases once inside) we went for the upgrade to a larger room with a window. I was very disappointed to see that a respectful hotel like the Best Western can have rooms like the first one we booked. 2/The second room was larger, but the shower was very unpractical, the sink was outside the bathroom and just after using it we noticed it was leaking. We didn't want to change our room again and alerted the staff of the leak but they didn't do anything about it. 3/ We had a terrible night's sleep because the room was very poorly soundproofed (we could hear all what was happening in the corridor and the surrounding rooms) and because we were woken up by two false alarms at 6am in the morning. When I called the front desk to ask whether we had to leave the building, they didn't even apologize! 4/ In the morining, we found out that we were sleeping with a lizard in the room. We left the hotel first thing in the morning and stayed in a much better and cheaper hotel on bencoolen street for the rest of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western - NOT!”
Reviews.Author: Life101
Reviews.Content: This was an 11 day stay and all relevant communication was done with the Hotel to ensure that my room was ready on check in. Well that did not happen and here is what transpired: 1) Room with high floor provided but aircon not working, so played the waiting game for another room that took a good 40 mins. After 12 hour flight this delay was not welcomed 2) Room 2 although with good Aircon, had a plethora of issues pictures provided a) Mold in bathroom shower b) Hole in bathroom ceiling due to water leakage from above c) Cracks or lack of proper grout filling between tiles d) Ants in the ROOM!! e) Sub standard linen supplied f) left over trash not cleaned from previous guest g) Could feel the springs on the bed h) walls and sound proofing practically zero... i) Bathroom amenities if not empty was topped up with water j) Buffet breakfast was infested with ants and fruit fly The positive: 1)One staff from mainteance was helpful but I could see his limitations 2) Hot water for shower 3) Cable TV reception worked fine 4) Wifi worked fine 5) General common areas were clean 6) Location 10 min walk to Clary Quay MRT have to cross road Summary Bestwester is an International Chain it has standards to uphold to be a hotel of choice. This Chian although new has already aged beyond its natural progression. This happens when the aim is to fill rooms and let standards subside. I could have stayed at other hotels for SGD200.00 a night but was hoping that this hotel would own upto Bestwestern reputation. Clearly they have not. I am hoping this review will enable them to act up!

Reviews.Title: “It was a really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: DungLuong
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a good location, right there in the central of singapore. Very near to Clarke Quay and the riverside. Appreciated to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cocok”
Reviews.Author: Bradstir
Reviews.Content: Good value for money hotel in good location between Clarke and Boat Quay. Walking distance to Chinatown and close Central Mall & Clarke Quay MRT. Complimentary Internet, small fridge, tea/coffee making facilities. Friendly staff. I experienced no problems with noise from the ethnic discotheque but was on the 6th floor. Breakfast was good and DVD player was provided on request. They did everything possible to make my stay comfortable. I had no problems with the cleanliness of the rooms, but then again I spoke a bit of Chinese to the cleaning staff and they supplied me extra biscuits :-). I also checked out the (relatively) new Porcelain hotel in Mosque Street but found Jayleen 1918 far better value for money and rooms more spacious than The Porcelain. I would recommend this hotel for those looking for good value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Kaushi0704
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the best location in Singapore bang between boat quay and clarke quay. The location suits best for all sort of travellers be it business or leisure. The rooms are of a size of match box but nicely done; more of an european concept. The windows dont have any view and it just opens upto other similar kind of rooms. The breakfast room is small and informal type; breakfast options are very limited and minimal. The front office staffs were helpful and prompt. It was kind of let down when we entered the room for the first time but if you have to enjoy Singapore then you might as well compromise with the room size.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, small rooms...”
Reviews.Author: Carolina P
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location. Is perfect. Short walling distance from MRT, Clark Quay, Merlion, Chinatown... Staff was very friendly. From the reception to the kitchen people. I chose it for the price, but the smell of mold was terrible. I had to leave the door open every time ir was possible. There was no door separating the bedroom from the bathroom, which increased its humidity, and the smell. The first night I had problems to sleep because of the noise coming from a nightclub nextdoor. The nightclub works until 6am eevery single day. I askes to change my room, which they did, and the noise problem was much better, but I could still hear the music throughout the night. Also the noise coming from the corridor is kinf of disturbing. I also complained about the room cleaning, had to ask them to sweep the floor, which the cleaning lady didn't do during my whole stay (1 week). The towels had black hairs on it, every day they changed it, there was the hair again. Told them to complain with the laundry...Kinf of disgusting. In the overal I would recomend the hotel because of the location and the breakfast. But if you need a big room, or if you care too much about cleanliness, avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “it's not the best but good!”
Reviews.Author: attyrachelle
Reviews.Content: good location. 5 minutes walk to mrt,room is clean except for the stinking smell in the bathroom. staff are helpful except for 1 guy who i found to be arrogant & discourteous.we were left by the bus going to night safari because that guy was so inefficient & incompetent. it took us 30 mins. to check in because he kept on insisting that i made a reservation for an executive room when in fact i cancelled it & made a booking for a de luxe family room. he even told me that i have to call myself booking.com otherwise i will be charged for the 2 rooms & he can not accomodate us as they are fully booked.he was even asking for the print out of the cancellation & if i can't show it to him, he can not do anything.is that the proper way to treat a paying guest?do you usually talk to your guests in a loud & angry voice?good thing i brought my laptop w/ me & i told him that i will show him the email, when i said, that, that 's the only time he checked from their computer. on our 2nd night the aircon brokedown & was not fixed unti the next day. no bellboy, no trolley for the luggages, no one will assist you to bring up or bring down your luggages.during the night, the loud noise from the ktv bar beside the hotel can be heard in our room, noise starts 10pm-6am!a few noisy drunkards in front of the hotel. no hair dryer in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and decent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: eufejr
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were greeted by the very friendly and courteous receptionist (Irene). Our online booking had gone very smoothly and we had no problems at all with our hotel reservation when we got there. The room we got was a standard room with window, which was spacious enough for my wife and I. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Very high on our list was the availability of free Wi-Fi and a digital safe for valuables. The bathroom was nice and cozy, with adjustable water temperature, ample amount of tissue paper and bathroom/face/hand towels. The only problems we had were that the handheld shower could not be kept in place due to a loose holder, and the hotel room door was quite noisy when closing and locking. On the other hand, another plus was the free breakfast buffet. Drinking water and snack (cookies) were also provided and constantly replenished for each room. The hotel is very accessible to the MRT stations. Getting to the Merlion park, Boat Quaye, Clarke Quay, and Esplanade takes a few minutes by foot. Upon check-out, the receptionist was kind enough to book a taxi to take us to the airport. We would definitely recommend this hotel for those looking for a great location, free breakfast and Wi-Fi, and clean, decent rooms, at a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “location location, cant beat this”
Reviews.Author: reefcity
Reviews.Content: this hotel is perfectly located next to all attractions and within a 2 minute walk to the left is MRT, and across the road to the right is the river, the roof top is excellent to sit and watch marina bay sands and Singapore at night, the breakfast is more than adequate with various choices, we never had a problem with noise as other posters had found, we did stay on the top floor in the room with no window,it was small but I knew that when I booked, it was compact but very well appointed, I would stay here again without a second thought, as I said the location is excellent

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel close to clarke”
Reviews.Author: SurabhiMehta
Reviews.Content: Best western is located close to Clarke which is good It is a colonial look hotel The color palatte of the hotel is off white, cream and yellow which makes it look kinda bland the furnoiture looks old n boring The breakfast selection is limited Most of the rooms have twin beds and not king/queen beds

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and easily accessible”
Reviews.Author: pnair
Reviews.Content: Good clean and comfortable hotel. Near food outlets, MRT station adn shopping outlets

Reviews.Title: “Better than in pictures”
Reviews.Author: hydepark
Reviews.Content: My room looked better than the pictures in Tripadviser. When I was reading the reviews, I was a little concerned about the photos which showed a rather dark colour of the rooms. But to my pleasant surprise, my room was very bright. Also, it had free Internet. And the location is perfect, just a short walk to an MRT station. I wouldn't say this place is my 1st choice but it certainly fills a gap in the Singapore hotel market which has been badly missing, that of a hotel that is clean and comfortable while costing less than S$160 a night, including taxes, usually it would cost at least S$200 for this standard.

Reviews.Title: “We did not enjoy it and wont be back and would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: margie045
Reviews.Content: The airconditioning broke down at 4am and wasnt repaired until that afternoon. It was very hot and uncomfortable. There is a disco next door and loud disco music started at midnight and finished at 6am. The guest lounge is not conducive to relaxing as the manager's office in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for weekend, great location”
Reviews.Author: appletinigirl
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here, looking for abudget hotel - we choose BW as it is a known name, perfect place to stay, was clean, nice, and lovely service, very helpful staff. Room are small as also advised from the reception when booking, Not for big guys but if you want a clean,reasonably priced hotel with very helpgul staff, then this is a perfect location, 5 min walk to Calrke Quay and Baot Quak and business district, down the street from the malls and bars and restaurants and all the stations. Breakfast was great, lovely omlets, fruits, coffee/tea toast etc, included.

Reviews.Title: “Small, clean, comfortable & ideal location!”
Reviews.Author: AltafSarwar
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to use this hotel after reading some of the previous reviews as I was unsure of the location of this hotel. Especially if it was in a safe area. As mentioned by all others, the rooms are very small. To open a suitcase you have to use the bed or dresser. The bathroom opens into the bedroom (no door) so there is no privacy - this was not an issue for me but could be for others. The rooms are small, clean, they have a TV, fridge & the basics. The staff are very helpful and the manager does everything to make your stay enjoyable. I could hear music at nights from the club next door through the night, so if you're a light sleeper this is not the place for you. Once again, this was not an issue for me. Singapore is one of the safest, cleanest & modern places I've visited - & I travel a lot! So this hotel is an ideal location. The nearest underground is about 300m away & it costs about £8 to the airport (travelling 6am - midnight) in a metered taxi. We stayed for 3 days & this hotel was ideal for our visit. Most of our time was spent exploring the city & the hotel is ideal to put your head down. Breakfast is basic & we paid approx. £80 per night (booking.com) which is a reasonable rate. The hotel is about 10 minutes walk from chinatown & 20 minutes from little india.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, very clean and close to MRT and shopping”
Reviews.Author: Michael O
Reviews.Content: For a two or three day stay in Singapore this place is ideal. Staff very friendly, room was clean yet a bit on the small side, but I think this maybe the case with most accommodation is Singapore for a medium priced place. The location was perfect for us, as you had the shopping mall around the corner with the MRT underneath which also made it so easy to get around. Area was also quiet with no traffic noise and breakfast was included daily downstairs in their dining area. Some authentic Singapore dining places full of locals just around the corner or head south four blocks and your in China Town. For a 3 night stay it was perfect, any longer I would consider somewhere a little larger, but if your out and about like us it was great

Reviews.Title: “Get you're money's worth!”
Reviews.Author: kyrise
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay at this hotel for 4N & 5D. Excellent service and location. Very good wifi connection, in-room freebies & buffet breakfast. Reasonable room size. All in all, an excellent choice! Kudos to all the staff!! I would definitely book with this hotel again. ü

Reviews.Title: “Homely hotel in quiet area”
Reviews.Author: Localtourist12
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay here with my family (2 young kids) after reading the reviews on tripadvisor. And this hotel was within our budget, other hotels wanted us to take 2 rooms for our family. Pretty much all that has been said about the hotel is true - eg breakfast, noise at night from the 2 pub / music lounge situated on either side. The noise did not really bothered me. The beds and the way the room is furnished is very homely type. Have a look at the pictures. There was one particular staff at the reception which deserves special mention. She was very helpful and very motherly like all the more making me and my family feel like we're staying in someone's home rather than a hotel. The shower door seal at the bottom is not good and the shower floor is not high enough so water spills over outside of the shower area and wetting the bathroom. This and the swinging door which I can't lock properly was the only really minus points There's no room service but if you out all day exploring Singapore why would one need room service? The high speed internet is not bad (I tested it to be 2 Mbps) I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and NOTHING else!”
Reviews.Author: AashishSharma
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very close to Singapore's Clarke Quay. Also, there are 2 MRT stations at a short walking distance, which is also very convenient. The staff are very polite and helpful (especially Devi at the front-desk). The wi-fi is free and easily accessible all over the hotel. There were 2 main things I did not like: the hotel is located right next to a bar that plays extremely loud music till 6AM - every night! Because of this I was unable to sleep. The breakfast spread is good, but the presentation and taste are very poor (I ate just once). This hotel is a good option for back-packers & budget travelers, as the price (for Clarke Quay) is very competitive. For business travelers and those with families, I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well located but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: MXLondon Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights whilst visiting SIngapore. The hotel is well located between Chinatown and the CBD and we walked to most of the major sights of the city. The hotel is small and our room was compact (a superior room). The decor was not really to my taste but at least it wasn't bland! The room was clean and well furnished with a fridge, wireless internet, flatscreen TV etc. However, as others have commented, this hotel is very noisy. As the hotel is not carpeted it is easy to hear footsteps and doors closing in to other rooms. The biggest noise problem is the nightclub next door which is open until 6AM. This kept me awake for two of the three nights I was there (and I'm not a particularly light sleeper). On one morning we decided to have a lie-in as we had slept so badly and left the do not disturb sign outside our door only to be woken at 9AM by the housekeepers having a long and loud conversation right outside our room! Breakfast was OK although not great (a buffet with quite odd things on, such as spaghetti bolognaise and chips). Staff in the breakfast room and the front desk were all friendly and efficient. I liked the individual nature of this hotel and know it's not the hotel's fault that it is so noisy, but I can not really recommend it to others based on the noise.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice, on eastern edge of Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: Arandale
Reviews.Content: Smallish bedroom, but good value considering the quality of the furniture and fittings, the hotel's location close to the city centre and helpful staff. Small problem for some perhaps, is the walk-in shower. The shower is good, but the bathroom floor inevitably gets very wet. A small but reasonable selection of hot & cold food for breakfast. A good range of TV channels, including international news channels.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and good location”
Reviews.Author: dalesman98
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel in an old building. The location is excellent, with a subway station five minutes away and both Clark's Quay and Chinatown within walking distance. Our room was small and had only limited storage, but everything worked and the room had everything you need. There was free wired and wireless internet which worked well. There was no view from our room - just a wall and windows. The washbasin was in the room with the shower and toilet in the bathroom. Not all that unusual but as the room was small, it did make brushing your teeth something of a public event. I guess it's a function of the size of the room. Breakfast is included but the choice is limited. Fresh fruit and various kinds of bread for toasting were the best choice. There were other choices including rice and curry but they didn't look very appetizing, so I never tried them. Tea and coffee were OK but the orange juice was a bland cordial. There are no public rooms,other than the breakfast room, so when it rains and it rained a lot when we were there, you are pretty much stuck in your room. The front desk staff were were very helpful and friendly. There are a couple of nightclubs on the street nearby and although we could hear the music, it was never a problem and didn't keep us awake. Although the hotel isn't luxurious, it's perfectly adequate and for a short stay (three or four days) I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A well located 3.5 star Parisien hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Juledan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Jayleen 1918 in december 2010. It is a new hotel; to describe it in a few words think of it as a 3.5 star Parisien hotel. We stayed in one of the bigger rooms (superior) and for its size it was acceptable for us.  In the room everything we desired was available and more: tea and coffee making facilities, free bottles of water, free WiFi and flatscreen satelite tv. We liked the location. Its very central and as the MRT is less than five minutes away one can basically travel to anywhere in Singapore. We didn't expect that the Riverfront area is so nice to go out to during the evening. There was a misunderstanding about the promotional rate but the hotel staff solved it quickly and professionaly to our satisfaction. The staff was also very helpful and hapily answered all our questions. The breakfast was ok (although most of the time we went straight to Maxwell food court). What could be improved is the shower: leaking and when you have shower the whole bathroom is wet. All in all we can definitely recommend the Jayleen 1918.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: RolandDSilva
Reviews.Content: New hotel in the heart of Singapore - walking distance to boat quay and clarke quay, as well as to the metro. The room was compact but well appointed, and very clean. Staff were pleasant. Would recommend this hotel to a budget traveller and would definitely stay there again if I visit Singapore.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Jayleen 1918
HotelInfo.Address: 42 Carpenter Street, Singapore 059921, Singapore
